content:
• Monday, March 27, 2017

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: OTCPK:PSIX +47.0%. VSTM +8.3%. OCN +6.3%. TSRO +5.2%. RHT +4.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: INAP -4.0%. BTE -2.6%. HIMX -2.2%. DOOR -2.1%. TVIX -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • INAP

    Internap files resale of 27.2M common stock shares

    • To be sold by selling stockholders from time to time through a proposed approximate $94.7M maximum aggregate offering at a proposed maximum price of $3.48 per share.
    • Internap (NASDAQ:INAP) $3.65, -3.7% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 10 Comments
  • DRI

    Darden Restaurants buys Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen for $780M

    • Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) agrees to acquire Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen from shareholders including P-E firms L Catterton and Oak Investment Partners for $780M.
    • DRI says Cheddar's, which has 165 locations across 28 states, will add a casual dining chain to its restaurant portfolio.
    • DRI expects the deal to be accretive to FY 2018 adjusted earnings by ~$0.12/share.
    • DRI, which also announced better than expected quarterly earnings and guided FY 2017 earnings above consensus, +3.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • PSIX

    Power Solutions +54% after Chinese firm commits to $60M investment

    • Power Solutions International (OTCPK:PSIX) +53.9% AH after announcing that Weichai America, a Chinese designer and manufacturer of diesel engines, will invest $60M in the company through a combination of newly issued common shares and preferred shares.
    • As part of the agreement, Weichai will purchase ~2.73M newly issued common shares at $8.00/share and ~2.38M shares of series B convertible perpetual preferred stock, plus a warrant exercisable for more than 4M common shares; following the transactions, Weichai will own 40.7% of PSIX, with the warrants, if exercised, lifting ownership to 51%.
    • PSIX says it will use the $60M to refinance its debt structure, supporting its long-term growth objectives.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • CYRX

    Cryoport readies equity offering; shares slump 25% after hours

    • Cryoport (NASDAQ:CYRX) initiates a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced. Shares are down 25% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • EVH

    Evolent Health shareholders prepare to unload 7.5M common shares; shares ease 1% after hours

    • Evolent Health (NYSE:EVH) slips 1% after hours on average volume in response to its announcement of a public offering of 7.5M shares of Class A common stock. All shares are being sold by existing institutional shareholders. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 1.125M shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat +4.3%; Q4 2017, forecasted revenues over expectations

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $629M (+15.7% Y/Y, $10.24M above estimates), EPS $0.61 (in line), subscription revenue $560M (+17% Y/Y), Application development-related and other emerging technology subscription revenue $125M (+40% Y/Y), year-end deferred revenue $2.1B (+20% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $643M-$650M (consensus $642.38M), EPS $0.52-$0.53 (consensus $0.59), operating margin 20%
    • FY 2018 projections – revenue $2.72B-$2.76B (consensus $2.71B), EPS $2.60-$2.64 (consensus $2.59), operating margin 23.6%, operating cash flow $850M-$870M
    • After hours – (NYSE:RHT) $85.70
    • Press release / conference call / foreign exchange rates summary / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSRO

    TESARO to expand development program for PARP inhibitor Zejula; FDA approval sends shares up 8% after hours

    • TESARO (NASDAQ:TSRO) announces a substantial expansion of clinical development of just-FDA-approved niraparib (ZEJULA). It plans to initiate registration programs for metastatic ovarian, breast and lung cancers.
    • The FDA approved ZEJULA today for the maintenance treatment of ovarian cancer.
    • Shares are up 8% after hours on robust volume. PARP competitor Clovis Oncology (NASDAQ:CLVS) is down 1% on increased volume. AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) is up a fraction.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 6 Comments
  • DRI

    Darden Restaurants +4% after boosting profit guidance

    • Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) reports same-restaurant sales increased 0.9% in FQ3 vs. +0.3% consensus estimate. Six of seven chains reported a positive comp for the quarter.
    • Same-restaurant sales by brand: Olive Garden +1.4%, Longhorn Steakhouse +0.2%, Capital Grille +0.9%, Yard House -1.0%, Eddie V's +4.7%, Seasons 52 +0.8, Bahama Breeze +0.5%.
    • "We continued to gain market share as we outperformed industry same-restaurant sales by a considerable margin again this quarter," notes CEO Gene Lee.
    • Darden boosted its view for FY17 EPS to $3.95 to $4.00 vs. $3.87 to $3.97 prior. The company expects FY17 same-restaurant sales growth of 1.5%.
    • Previously: Darden Restaurants beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (March 27)
    • DRI +3.86% AH to $78.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 6 Comments
  • RHT

    Red Hat EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q4 EPS of $0.61 in-line.
    • Revenue of $629M (+15.7% Y/Y) beats by $10.24M.
    • Shares +3.25%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRI

    Darden Restaurants beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI): FQ3 EPS of $1.32 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $1.88B (+1.6% Y/Y) beats by $10M.
    • Shares +3.3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • TSRO

    FDA OKs TESARO's niraparib

    • The FDA approves TESARO's (NASDAQ:TSRO) PARP inhibitor niraparib, branded as ZEJULA, for the maintenance treatment of women with recurrent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube or primary peritoneal cancer who are in complete or partial response to platinum-based chemo.
    • ZEJULA is the first PARP inhibitor that does not require BRCA mutation or other biomarker testing. Market launch will commence in late April.
    • Update: The company says it will release the price when it rolls out the product next month.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 7 Comments
  • STOR

    Capital raise for STORE Capital; shares -1.8% after hours

    • The company is selling 7.6M shares of common stock, with underwriter greenshoe of 1.14M shares.
    • The net lease player is down 5% YTD, and 9% Y/Y.
    • STOR -1.8% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 24 Comments
  • FNV

    Franco Nevada upgraded to Buy on forecast production boost

    • Franco Nevada (FNV +2.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $83 price target, raised from $71, at TD Securities, which expects the company's production to grow by 16% over the next five years.
    • The firm likes FNV's unique business model of helping finance projects in exchange for a portion of future revenues, instead of owning or operating mines; "at a time when many gold producers are struggling to keep production flat, Franco’s fully funded growth profile sets it apart," TD says.
    • “Management noted that it expects to be active in writing stream agreements with base metal and precious metal miners as the next wave of mine development gets underway," the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMZN

    Barclays calls out 'staggering' traffic drop at Whole Foods

    • There's another shot at Whole Foods (WFM) from a Wall Street firm and this one is a doozy.
    • Barclays calls the magnitude of the traffic declines for the grocery store chain "staggering" in terms of raw numbers.
    • "We estimate ~9M-14M annual transactions left WFM in the last 6 quarters and KR, which has meaningful overlap with WFM, is likely a direct beneficiary of WFM’s share losses," reads the firm's note.
    • Whole Foods has averaged a 3% loss in traffic over the last five quarters.
    • Shares of Whole Foods are down 1.38% to $28.52. vs. a 52-week trading range of $27.67 to $35.58.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 43 Comments
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration sees Q1 production topping high end of guidance

    • Newfield Exploration (NFX +3%) is higher after forecasting Q1 2017 domestic production to average ~137.7K boe/day, or 3.5K boe/day better than the upper end of original guidance of 132K-134.2K boe/day.
    • NFX also says its new, industry leading Burgess well in the heart of the company's 300K-plus net STACK acres achieved a 24-hour flow rate of 2,931 boe/day and a 20-day average rate of 2,492 boe/day.
    • Also, NFX CEO Lee Boothby tells Bloomberg the company will move ahead with plans to expand drilling despite oil’s recent slide, saying NFX can still generate double-digit growth and stay within cash flow at $50/bbl.
    • “Right now, I’m not feeling any stress in terms of prices," Boothby says, adding that while NFX may divest Bakken assets at some point, “we don’t have any need to sell today."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSRO

    Doctors see no clear frontrunner in PARP race; TESARO down 2% on lack of leadership of niraparib

    • TESARO (TSRO -2.1%) slips on below average volume on the heels of a survey of doctors conducted by Jefferies that revealed no clear winner among cancer immunotherapies called PARP inhibitors. Investors perceive the equivocation as a negative for niraparib.
    • Analyst Eun Yang says the poll of 29 oncologists revealed that other PARPs are "more similar" that previously assumed, undermining the Street's view that niraparib is the top dog. 10 of the 29 physicians viewed niraparib as the most effective while eight viewed the drugs as similar. Other PARP inhibitors are AstraZeneca's (AZN +1.6%) olaparib (Lynparza) and Clovis Oncology's (CLVS -3%) rucaparib (Rubraca). AbbVie (ABBV +0.7%) and Pfizer (PFE +0.6%) are working on candidates as well.
    • Yang's poll also suggests that a broad label "may not translate into a big advantage." In maintenance therapy in BRCA-positive ovarian cancer (the largest expected opportunity), 30% of respondents favored olaparib, 25% niraparib and 20% rucaparib.
    • She adds that potential Clovis suitors will probably wait for further data and more insignt into AZN's recent data before making a move. She believes TSRO is already exchanging hands near the takeout price so there is significant downside risk for longs.
    • Source: The Fly
    • Nasdaq has halted trading pending news.
    • Update: TSRO resumed trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 16 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: SYX +29%. SCON +23%. DGLY +14%. INPX +14%. HMNY +11%.
    • Losers: MSDI -11%. SWIR -7%. CCIH -7%. CMCM -7%. DQ -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AU

    Colombia location of potential AngloGold project votes to ban mining

    • Voters in Colombia's Tolima province approve a proposal to ban mining projects in their municipality, raising questions about the future of AngloGold Ashanti's (AU +3.2%) La Colosa mine, a $2B potential investment that could yield 28M oz. of gold.
    • AU has invested ~$900M in Colombia since 2006, including at La Colosa, the largest of its three projects in the country, but commodity producers have been increasingly concerned about recent court decisions banning exploration on land already awarded in concessions and giving local authorities greater power to reject mining projects.
    • AU has been exploring at the site in central Colombia for more than a decade.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • SPWH

    Sportsman's Warehouse lower after Goldman cut

    • Sportsman's Warehouse (SPWH -5.4%) trades lower after Goldman Sachs drops the retailer to a Neutral rating after having it slotted at Buy.
    • The firm cites a lack of positive catalysts for Sportsman's Warehouse and sees liquidity constraints playing in.
    • Goldman cuts its price target by 24% to $6.50 off estimates of FY17 EPS of $0.68 and FY18 EPS of $0.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 19 Comments
  • VIA

    Viacom officially taps Gianopulos to lead Paramount

    • As expected, Viacom (VIA +3.5%, VIAB +2%) has installed Jim Gianopulos as chairman and chief executive officer at Paramount Pictures, where he'll replace ousted chief Brad Grey.
    • The move fills one of two gaps atop major Hollywood studios. Sony Pictures is still on the hunt for a replacement for outgoing chief Michael Lynton.
    • Gianopulos is a veteran of Fox, previously serving for 16 years as chairman/CEO of Fox Filmed Entertainment, and before that as president of Twentieth Century Fox International.
    • He'll oversee film and TV operations worldwide in all facets for Paramount, including production, marketing and distribution.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: GBR +75%. DELT +12%. KGJI +12%. LTBR +10%. GEVO +11%.
    • Losers: FRAC -6%. ERN -6%. HOS -6%. ACH -6%. AXAS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Disney's 'Beauty and the Beast' among fastest films to $317M

    • A second massive weekend for Beauty and the Beast (DIS +0.2%) kept it atop a strong box office, holding off a challenge from teen-hero challenger Power Rangers (LGF.A +2.6%; LGF.B +3.2%).
    • The Disney live-action remake drew $88.3M in early estimates, which along with strong weekday business brought its domestic take to $316.95M cumulative (one of the fastest films to get there). Strong Sunday numbers a week ago boosted its final take and might this week as well.
    • Foreign results continue to be strong as well, giving the picture a $690.3M cumulative worldwide gross.
    • Power Rangers was a distant second with $40.5M, while Kong: Skull Island (TWX -0.3%) hung in at No. 3 with $14.4M. Strong global results have boosted Kong's worldwide take to cumulative $392M in its third week of release.
    • In other new releases, space thriller Life (SNE +0.8%) settled at No. 4 with a disappointing $12.6M, while TV-series adaptation CHIPS (NYSE:TWX) was No. 7 with just $7.6M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 45 Comments
  • ASPS

    Altisource Portfolio up another 6% as short squeeze story gets legs

    • S3 Partners' Ihor Dusaniwsky tells Bloomberg, that short interest is 31% of the market cap and a full 59% of the float vs. 21% and 39%, respectively, one month ago.
    • New borrows today are being charged as much as 100%, while outstanding shorts are paying 60%. He sees rates on existing borrows rising to 75% by the end of the week.
    • Meanwhile on Seeking Alpha, contributor Amit Shamir paints a similarly dire picture for the shorts.
    • Altisource Portfolio Solutions (NASDAQ:ASPS) up 6.4% today, and up 23% in the last three sessions.
    • Previously: Shorts press bets in Altisource Portfolio Solutions (March 24)
    • Previously: Short squeeze building in Altisource Portfolio Solutions? (March 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • TI

    Former Ferrari chairman in lead to chair Telecom Italia board

    • Luca Cordero Di Montezemolo -- former chairman of Ferrari, and currently chairman of Alitalia -- is a front-runner to take over the board at Telecom Italia (TI +2.1%), Bloomberg reports.
    • That impetus comes from top shareholder Vivendi (VIVHY +1.4%), which might yet keep on Giuseppe Recchi as chairman. But switching to Montezemolo could get more power to TI CEO Flavio Cattaneo.
    • Cattaneo was previously CEO at Montezemolo's high-speed rail company NTV. Montezemolo is planning to leave Alitalia's chairmanship once funding for a new restructuring plan there is approved.
    • Telecom Italia investors face an April 9 deadline for board-slate proposals, ahead of the May 4 annual meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM

  • Stocks erase most losses

    • Down sizably in the early going, the major averages have returned to little-changed on the session, with the Nasdaq even poking its head into green territory.
    • Leading to the downside earlier, banks have about halved their losses, with the KBE down 1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 9 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: APOP +79%. GBR +75%. IPXL +30%. SYX +29%. SCON +21%. NXTD +18%. RGLS +18%. ITUS +15%. INPX +15%. PLSE +14%.
    • Losers: FOMX -45%. GIII -13%. ZAIS -11%. MSDI -9%. SWIR -8%. NVCN -8%. WPRT -8%. CMCM -8%. LEJU -8%. XBIT -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • MTNB

    Matinas BioPharma reports positive topline data from phase 1 study MAT2501; Shares +4%

    • Matinas BioPharma Holdings (MTNB +4%) today reported positive topline data from its Phase 1 single-ascending dose study of MAT2501 in healthy volunteers.
    • MAT2501 was well-tolerated with no serious adverse events reported in the study.
    • Oral administration of MAT2501 at all three doses yielded blood levels of amikacin that were well below the safety levels recommended for IV-administered amikacin, and consistent with the results from preclinical studies of MAT2501.
    • CEO Roelof Rongen: "We are very pleased with the outcome of our initial Phase 1 study of MAT2501 and believe that the results of this study support the further development of MAT2501 for the treatment of NTM infections as a first indication, “We have shown that the oral administration of MAT2501 at doses we expect to use with patients is well tolerated and yields blood levels well below the labeled safety limits for amikacin. Our plan is to continue to drive development of this important product forward in such a way as to maximize the opportunity we might have in developing and potentially receiving FDA-approval for what we believe will be the first orally-available aminoglycoside.”
    • See important disclosures.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • EXAS

    Aetna adds Cologuard to covered list; Exact up 7%

    • Exact Sciences (EXAS +7.3%) perks up on increased volume on the news that Aetna has added Cologuard to its list of covered tests for colorectal cancer screening, adding commercial coverage to the previously announced Medicare Advantage inclusion.
    • Aetna currently covers 18.6M lives.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • NUE

    Steel prices may peak near-term on cost deflation, Morgan Stanley says

    • Steel prices (SLX -1.6%) could see “tactical bumps in the road” in the near-term as a meaningful drop in the steel cost curve likely will create additional headwinds for global prices, ultimately impacting the U.S. market, Morgan Stanley analysts say.
    • The firm nevertheless says any cost deflation related price weakness should have little impact on the mid-cycle margin outlook, and while price cycles will never disappear, it believes structural improvements in the form of trade barriers and China supply side reform should allow margins to remain higher on average going forward.
    • Stanley recommends buying steel stocks on any weakness, and sees Nucor (NUE -1.4%), Steel Dynamics (STLD -1.6%) and U.S. Steel (X -4.2%) as its top picks.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: NAKD +8%. BTN +5%.
    • Losers: GIII -14%. WPRT -7%. OTIV -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • FIT

    Fitbit launches Alta HR worldwide; shares +4.9%

    • Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) is riding high, up 4.9%, on global launch day for its Alta HR wearable, which it says is the slimmest wristband with continuous heart rate tracking. It's early, as the company expected an April launch.
    • New software features planned for launch, including Sleep Stages and Sleep Insights, will be available this week in the Fitbit app (Windows, iOS/Android).
    • The company's pricing the Alta HR at $149.95 with its standard band, with upsell accessory bands ranging from $29.95-$179.95 additional.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 32 Comments
  • IPIX

    Cellceutix's Brilacidin shows encouraging treatment effect in OM patients in mid-stage study; shares ahead 3%

    • Preliminary data from a Phase 2 clinical trial, CTIX-BRI-205, assessing Cellceutix's (CTIX +2.6%) Brilacidin oral rinse for the prevention and control on oral mucositis (OM) in head and neck cancer patients receiving chemoradiation showed a significant treatment benefit.
    • The incidence of severe OM [WHO Grade >3 (oral ulcers, liquid diet only)] in the treatment group was 22.2% (n=2/9) compared to 70% (n=7/10) for placebo. The mean duration of severe OM also favored Brilacidin, 10.5 days vs. 14.0 days.
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated study completion date is December.
    • Brilacidin is a member of a new class of antibiotics called defensin-mimetics which are modeled after host defense proteins. These are the "front line" of defense in the human immune system.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 20 Comments
  • KTOS

    Defense names mull future of Trump agenda after healthcare failure

    • The entire agenda of the Trump administration - including boosted defense spending and lower taxes - is being called into question after the GOP's failure on healthcare.
    • Among the defense movers: Kratos (KTOS -1.5%), Northrop Grumman (NOC -0.6%), Mercury Systems (MRCY -4.2%), General Dynamics (GD -1.5%), Lockheed Martin (LMT -0.4%), L3 Technologies (LLL -1.5%), Textron (TXT -0.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 36 Comments
  • KATE

    Kate Spade-Coach deal expected around the corner

    • Kate Spade (NYSE:KATE) is up 1.92% after The Business of Fashion reports that an acquisition by Coach (COH +1.6%) could occur within weeks.
    • Shares of Kate are already up 63% over the last 90 days off of ongoing M&A speculation. Coash is up 15% same time period.
    • "There are synergies in sourcing from a leather perspective, and synergies in terms of global development," notes Cowen and Company's Oliver Chen on the potential combination.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 19 Comments
  • ONDK

    OnDeck deal not likely - Bloomberg GadFly

    • The stock got a quick pop on Thursday morning on a report that rival Kabbage was interested in purchasing, but the chances of deal don't seem particularly realistic, writes Gillian Tan.
    • The most obvious reason is that OnDeck's (NYSE:ONDK) earliest investors - who continue to own more than 45% of the company - are going to want far more than the standard takeout premium given that the stock trades at less than 25% of its IPO price.
    • Some other type of merger deal - in which OnDeck investors might be able to participate in future success - may make more sense. Trouble is currency: As a private company, Kabbage can't easily offer shares. A reverse merger seems unlikely as Kabbage has already raised money privately.
    • For now, the way forward for OnDeck seems to be delivering on its long-term promises to investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: APOP +76%. IPXL +23%. RGLS +14%. HTGM +13%. EKSO +11%.
    • Losers: FOMX -43%. NVCN -8%. NEOT -8%. ITGR -7%. ROSG-OLD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • WAGE

    Wageworks -7% after healthcare bill crumble

    • Wageworks (WAGE -6.8%) should be a casualty from the failure to pass Trumpcare, says Wells Fargo, downgrading to Market Perform from Outperform.
    • The stock was a high-riser post-election as HSAs were expected to be a big part of the Trump health care plan. Shares are now down about 14% since it began coming clear about 10 days ago that the bill was headed for defeat.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings breaks higher

    • Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) are up 9.29% to trade at their highest level since the company warned on its financial status early last week.
    • Some insider buying action from Eddie Lampert could be influencing trading on the company.
    • Previously: Sears -15% after 'going concern' warning (March 22)
    • SEC Form 4
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 44 Comments
  • NTGR

    Netgear -4% as Off Wall Street issues new Sell rating

    • Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) has slipped 4% after getting hit with a new Sell rating at Off Wall Street.
    • The firm expects disappointing results from Netgear as the company faces tougher competition.
    • It's set a price target of $36, implying a further 27% downside from today's lower price.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • BAC

    Bank correction leads retreat in markets

    • The major indexes are down just 0.6%, but the KRE and KBE are each lower by well over 2% in early action. This just in ... both of these banking indexes are off 10% this month.
    • The broader XLF is down 1.4% today, and 5.5% for the month.
    • Bank investors may be adjusting the odds of regulatory reform given the GOP's healthcare failure. There's also interest rates, and the curve continues to flatten with the 10-year yield down another six basis points to 2.36%.
    • Morgan Stanley is down 4% after Charles Peabody downgraded to Sell, citing a lofty valuation following a 60% Y/Y run higher.
    • Bank of America (BAC -2.4%), Goldman (GS -2.4%), Citigroup (C -0.9%), Regions (RF -2.5%), U.S. Bancorp (USB -1.7%), KeyCorp (KEY -2.2%), PNC Financial (PNC -2.1%), Fifth Third (FITB -2.4%), SunTrust (STI -2.5%), M&T (MTB -2.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 111 Comments
  • WFT

    Schlumberger, Weatherford launch fracking JV to rival Halliburton

    • Weatherford (WFT +8.5%) is an unusual gainer among oil and gas stocks in early trading following news of a fracking joint venture with Schlumberger (SLB -1%) that will rival Halliburton (HAL -3.2%) in size.
    • SLB will own 70% and be the operator of the OneStim hydraulic fracturing partnership, while WFT will own 30% and receive a one-time $535M cash payment.
    • The companies say the partnership will combine SLB’s large fracking fleet of high-horsepower pumps and WFT technologies used to stimulate multiple separate horizontal zones within shale wells.
    • The new JV will bring SLB closer to HAL, which has a total fleet of fracking pumps that add up to 3M horsepower, according to oilfield consultant Spears & Associates; SLB currently has ~2M hp and WFT has ~800K-1M hp.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 7 Comments
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharma files U.S. marketing application for expanded use of Trulance; shares ahead 1%

    • Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +0.7%) files a supplemental New Drug Application (sNDA) with the FDA seeking approval of TRULANCE (plecanatide) to treat adults with irritable bowel syndrome with constipation (IBS-C).
    • The FDA approved the guanylate cyclase-C agonist in January for the treatment of adults with chronic ideopathic constipation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 79 Comments
  • SWIR

    Sierra Wireless -8.2% as Raymond James cuts to Neutral

    • Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR) is 8.2% lower after getting its rating cut to Market Perform by Raymond James.
    • Shares had hit a 52-week high of $30.60 on Thursday. Raymond James' Steven Li had rated the stock an Outperform previously.
    • Li has raised the price target to $30 from a previous $23.50 -- so about 10% upside from today's now-lowered price.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 8 Comments

  • APOP

    First clinical trial patient treated with Cellect Bio's ApoGraft; shares ahead 22% premarket

    • Cellect Biotechnology (NASDAQ:APOP) heads north 22% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that the first cell transplant procedure has been performed using its ApoGraft technology in a blood cancer patient in its Phase 1/2 clinical trial.
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated final data collection date for the primary endpoint safety is February 2018. The estimated study completion date is September 2018.
    • ApoGraft is a stem cell selection process designed to reduce the risk of rejection known as Graft-versus-Host Disease (GvHD). The condition, occurring in as many as 50% of stem cell transplants, can be life-threatening.

  • ZIOP

    ZIOPHARM poised to advance lead gene therapy candidate into Phase 3; shares ahead 5% premarket

    • ZIOPHARM Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) perks up 5% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement that it has received FDA guidance from an End-of-Phase 2 meeting regarding lead gene therapy candidate Ad-RTS-hIL-12, in combination with orally administered veledimex, for the treatment of an aggressive type of brain cancer called recurrent glioblastoma (GBM).
    • The company plans to advance the gene therapy, which utilizes its RheoSwitch platform, into Phase 3 development this year. It will release details about the protocol design after completed discussions with clinical advisors and regulators.
    • Ad-RTS-hIL-12 is a novel gene therapy candidate for the controlled expression of interleukin-12 (IL-12), an essential protein for stimulating a T cell immune response to cancer. Veledimex is an oral activator ligand or "gene switch" which is used to control the expression of IL-12, a pro-inflammatory cytokine that produces serious side effects if over-expressed.

  • FOMX

    Foamix Pharma's FMX101 shows mixed results in two late-stage acne studies; shares plummet 47% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Foamix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FOMX) craters 47% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of mixed results from two Phase 3 clinical trials assessing FMX101 in people with moderate-to-severe acne.
    • One study, Trial 05, met both co-primary endpoints but the other, Trial 04 only met one. Specifically, both studies showed treatment with FMX101 produced statistically significant reductions in the number of inflammatory lesions versus baseline compared to vehicle (placebo) but only Trial 05 met the other primary endpoint of a statistically significantly greater proportion of patients achieving success as measured by a scale called IGA (14.67% vs 7.89%; p=0.0423). Trial 04 came up short (8.09% vs. 4.77%; p=0.2178).
    • The company has yet to complete the full data analysis.
    • FMX101 is a proprietary 4% minocycline (antibiotic) foam formulation.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 16 Comments

    • Thinly traded nano cap ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) comes up empty again with lead product candidate tivantinib.   • AGN

    Allergan's oral antibiotic successful in two late-stage acne studies

    • Two Phase 3 clinical trials assessing Allergan's (NYSE:AGN) orally administered sarecycline in people with moderate-to-severe acne met their 12-week primary efficacy endpoints. Based on the successful results, it intends to file a New Drug Application (NDA) with the FDA in H2.
    • Participants receiving 1.5 mg/kg/day of sarecycline experienced statistically significant reductions in inflammatory lesion counts compared to placebo.
    • The most common adverse events in the treatment group were nausea (3.2%), nasopharyngitis (2.8%) and headache (2.8%). The discontinuation rate in the combined studies was 1.4%.
    • Allergan obtained the U.S. rights to sarecycline, a narrow spectrum tetracycline-derived antibiotic, from from Paratek Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PRTK).
    • Paratek is up 11% premarket but only on 320 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM
  • AUPH

    Aurinia Pharma's voclosporin shows sustained treatment benefit in LN patients after 48 weeks; shares ahead 6% premarket

    • Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUPH) perks up 6% premarket on average volume in response to its announcement of positive results from an open-label study, AURION, assessing lead product candidate voclosporin in patients with lupus nephritis (LN). The results were presented at the 12th International Congress on Systemic Lupus Erythematosus and 7th Asian Congress on Autoimmunity in Melbourne, Australia.
    • The study met its primary endpoint of demonstrating that early biomarker response in active LN patients can be a significant predictor of renal response at weeks 24 and 48.
    • At week 48, 71% (n=5/7) of subjects on treatment remained in complete remission as measured by urinary protein creatinine ratio (UPCR) of no more than -0.5 mg/mg and other metrics. A 25% reduction in UPCR at week 8 was found to be highly predictive of achieving renal response at weeks 24 and 48.
    • AURION is a 10-subject exploratory study being conducted in Malaysia.
    • Voclosporin suppresses the immune system by inhibiting an enzyme called calcineurin, which activates T cells. Its value proposition is similar effectiveness to other calcineurin inhibitors (cyclosporin and tacrolimus) without the deleterious side effects.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 22 Comments
